item.title: J.M. add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "He must have looked up at an unfamiliar sky through frightening leaves and shivered as he found what a grotesque thing a rose is. and how raw the sunlight was upon the scarcely created grass." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Bill Clinton
item.description: "All America loses when any person is denied or forced out of a job because of sexual orientation. Being gay, the last time I thought about it, seemed to have nothing to do with the ability to read a balance book, fix a broken bone, or change a spark plug." -- Bill Clinton

item.title: J.M. add a quote by T.S. Eliot
item.description: "I have seen the moment of my greatness flicker, and I have seen the eternal Footman hold my coat, and snicker, and in short, I was afraid." -- T.S. Eliot

item.title: J.M. add a quote by J.K. Rowling
J.M. add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "The animals have no need for speech, why talk when you are a word." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Evelyn Waugh
item.description: "Once you start changing a name, you see, there's no reason ever to stop. One always hears one that sounds better." -- Evelyn Waugh

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Yevgeny Zamyatin
item.description: "Was it not I who populated with them all these pages—just recently no more than white rectangular deserts? Without me, would they ever be seen by those whom I shall lead behind me along the narrow paths of lines?" -- Yevgeny Zamyatin

item.title: J.M. add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "Whenever you feel like criticizing any one...just remember that all the people in this world haven't had the advantages that you've had." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Carson McCullers
item.description: "How can the dead be truly dead when they still live in the souls of those who are left behind?" -- Carson McCullers

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Tom Robbins
item.description: "Be your own flying saucer! Rescue yourself!" -- Tom Robbins

item.title: J.M. add a quote by ZORA NEALE HURSTON
item.description: "Sometimes, I feel discriminated against, but it does not make me angry. It merely astonishes me. How <i>can</i> any deny themselves the pleasure of my company? It’s beyond me." -- ZORA NEALE HURSTON

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "Here is a lesson in creative writing. First rule: Do not use semicolons. They are transvestite hermaphrodites representing absolutely nothing. All they do is show you've been to college." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: J.M. add a quote by J.M. Snyder
item.description: "If ever the day comes when he wakes beside me and my name doesn't come to his lips, when that bewildered look in his eyes doesn't fade away, I'll remember for us both. I won't let him forget the life we built together. I won't let him go." -- J.M. Snyder

item.title: J.M. add a quote by L.M. Montgomery
item.description: "Isn't it nice to think that tomorrow is a new day with no mistakes in it yet?" -- L.M. Montgomery

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Isadora Duncan
item.description: "You were once wild here. Don’t let them tame you." -- Isadora Duncan

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "I have never listened to anyone who criticized my taste in space travel, sideshows or gorillas. When this occurs, I pack up my dinosaurs and leave the room." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Ann Patchett
item.description: "It makes you wonder. All the brilliant things we might have done with our lives if only we suspected we knew how." -- Ann Patchett

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Nadezhda Mandelstam
item.description: "I decided it is better to scream. Silence is the real crime against humanity." -- Nadezhda Mandelstam

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Edward Albee
item.description: "You're alive only once, as far as we know, and what could be worse than getting to the end of your life and realizing you hadn't lived it?" -- Edward Albee

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Alice Hoffman
item.description: "Books may well be the only true magic." -- Alice Hoffman

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Margaret Walker
item.description: "When I was about eight, I decided that the most wonderful thing, next to a human being, was a book." -- Margaret Walker

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Wole Soyinka
item.description: "The greatest threat to freedom is the absence of criticism." -- Wole Soyinka

item.title: J.M. add a quote by David Henry Hwang
item.description: "I'm happy. Which often looks like crazy." -- David Henry Hwang

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Maria Montessori
item.description: "Imagination does not become great until human beings, given the courage and the strength, use it to create." -- Maria Montessori

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "When I look at my life and its secret colours, I feel like bursting into tears." -- Albert Camus

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Umberto Eco
item.description: "We live for books." -- Umberto Eco

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Tennessee Williams
item.description: "I've got the guts to die. What I want to know is, have you got the guts to live?" -- Tennessee Williams

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Erica Jong
item.description: "Everyone has talent. What's rare is the courage to follow it to the dark places where it leads." -- Erica Jong

item.title: J.M. add a quote by Ian Fleming
item.description: "Never say 'no' to adventures. Always say 'yes,' otherwise you'll lead a very dull life." -- Ian Fleming
